intro: Lipochaeta waimeaensis, commonly known as the Waimea heath, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, forested areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Lipochaeta waimeaensis is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in montane rainforests.
